1.content:
We're living in 2351. Mankind has spent almost all minerals on Earth and completely covered it with buildings to live in and machines to supply all the vital things such like air, fresh water or food. Since such a world could nothing but create social conflicts and violence, all governements has finaly decided years after years to finaly mix into one giant country which aimed all its hope above the sky.

Since any mission in space are risky, only poor people are trained to be sent in different planets described as suitable for living on it.
Their goal? Keeping a radio nearby them and send all information about the lands, ores, living being and climate to the station on Earth while building a settlement and waiting for more humans to join them in order to take control of the new world and eventualy getting back home with a good pay... or just disapearing/dying leaving nothing behind you but several costs payed by the spatial agency to your relatives if you got any...

Since such a job was a chance to get fame and escape from poverty, you obviously joined a crew to explore one of these planets, and your planet wasn't the best choice : Therianthriopia, a planet where the three previous expeditions failed, vanishing without leaving any signal behind.
You knew that your chances wasn't high to succeed... but you were not alone to think that way.

Around you is a crew composed by about ten persons but no time to know each other, you had to join your cryogenic chamber and wait for the moment you'll wake up when it will finaly land on the planet. But before going to sleep, you had to scan to the machine your crew member card.

choices: You'll find out that everyone is fortunately okay.
They are all dead, you're alone.
11.content:
You lyed down and closed your eyes while the frost was invading the room. The sleep got immediately caught before you could even feel it coming. The engine was on, you are now gone to a long trip to Therianthriopia... You thought you would have landed peacefuly and see the light coming in the room, being able to exchange your first words with the crew... unfortunately, such thing will never happen.

Once you open your eyes again after a very long sleep that seemed to be a second, you can see around you nothing but dust flying around and fire. Still confuse like awaking after a bad party, you are looking around to check what was just happening.

You think in a first time that you are certainly dreaming during the trip and all of these was nothing, but when this engine a few meters from your position just blew up, making you feel hot waves of air, you realize how critical the situation was... you just crashed.

Still a bit blind and dizzy, you scream to be noticed by eventual survivors and see if despite how the brutal landing you just go through, your team was still alive.
11.title: How many people to get started with?

info.brief_description: You lost yourself in a foreign planet lived by mysterious being called furries.
info.description:
INTRO :

We're in 2351. Mankind has spent almost all minerals on Earth and aimed all its hope above the sky.

You joined a crew to explore new worlds to serve the governement and hope to escape poverty, but the planet chosen for your mission was the dreadful "Therianthriopia", known to be the one from no one ever come back...

A fate that you may eventualy escape... or not...

------ RULES AND UNIVERSE ------

Stick to the following rules and your post won't be edited or deleted.

General rules :

1) Try to type at least more than five lines for each chapter unless it's a choice chapter.
2) Do not abuse choices chapters if it's not necessary.
3) Always try to make the main character behaving in a realistic way. (for example, be at least surprised the first time you meet a furry).
4) To have a novel more uniform and immersive, use a Second Person Point of View in your narration.
5) Take care on the spelling. I won't bother you that much with it but at least try to write properly.
6) Once you have chosen your character, the crash or whatever that makes you stuck on the planet MUST happen.

Universe information :

- Living in Earth is hard but your character is not obliged to hate his previous life.

- Anthros' sizes can be different from humans but do not populate the planet with oversized giant furries. I could accept their world to be populated by one or two giant living in a lair but this one should not be as tall as a mountain and should be obviously feared by other anthros.

-You can meet humans from previous expedition who could have survived or their equipements.

-Your character can be armed since this planet could be dangerous.

-Death is allowed and end the story.

-Magic is tolerated but should be not overused, especially when it comes to shrink or transform people ! If such thing happen it should be a way to change back in order to feed the quest instead of blocking it.

-Sex and love stories are allowed. Just don't make it too easy.

-You can obviously escape but don't make it happening too early.

-You can't play as an Anthro unless something changed you for a good reason.

-Furries' plans to human are up to you. You can decide if they enslave, kill, torture, love or idolize humans.

-Furries can speak the main character's language or not.

-Furries' technology will depend on your choices during the story.
